text: Raja gopura Yadhava Kannan Temple, Thanjavur:ta:தஞ்சாவூர் யாதவ கண்ணன் கோயில் , is a Vishnu temple in (also known as Karanthai), a suburb of Thanjavur in Thanjavur district in Tamil Nadu (India). ==Structure== The temple was built during the period of Pratap Singh during 1755 A.D., கரந்தை ஸ்ரீயாதவ கண்ணன் (ஸ்ரீகிருஷ்ண ஜெயந்தி 23.8.2019), தினமணி, 23 ஆகஸ்டு 2019 The temple has raja gopura, garbhagriha, inner prakara, vimana and front mandapa. . ==Presiding deity== The Presiding deity Venugopalasamy is found with Bama and Rukmini. The processional deity, Yadhava Kannan, is in dancing posture. In the inner prakara, Tirupati Balaji is found in standing posture. ==Festivals== Krishna Jayanthi and Navaneetha Sevai are important festivals of the temple. Krishna Jayanthi is celebrated 11 days. During the Navaneetha Sevai, the processional deity of this temple would go around the town along with other deities of Vishnu temples and bless the people. தஞ்சையில் 15 பெருமாள்கள் நவநீத சேவை, மாலை மலர், 30 மே 2016 ==Kumbhabhishekham== The Kumbhabhishekham of the temple was held on 2 July 2018. யாதவ கண்ணன் கோயில் கும்பாபிஷேகம், தினமலர், 2 சூலை 2018 ==Other temples== Boolaga Krishnan Temple and Vittoba Temple are other Kannan temples found in Thanjavur. தஞ்சாவூர் அரண்மனை தேவஸ்தானத்தைச் சேர்ந்த ஆலயங்கள், தஞ்சை இராஜராஜேச்சரம் திருக்குட நன்னீராட்டுப் பெருவிழா மலர், 1997 ==References== ==Photogallery== File:Yadhavakannan temple2.jpg| File:Yadhavakannan temple4.jpg| File:Yadhavakannan temple5.jpg| File:Yadhavakannan temple6.jpg| File:Yadhavakannan temple7.jpg| File:Yadhavakannan temple8.jpg| Category:Hindu temples in Thanjavur Category:Vishnu temples
title: Yadhava Kannan Temple, Thanjavur
